newsitem.title: USA: Pena calls for speedy renewal of aviation taxes.
newsitem.headline: Pena calls for speedy renewal of aviation taxes.

text.p: Transportation Secretary Federico Pena on Tuesday called on Congress to quickly approve a short-term extension of aviation trust fund taxes that finance the Federal Aviation Administration.
"Every day that passes without renewal results in a loss of almost $20 million," Pena said in a statement.
The largest funding mechanism for the trust fund, a 10 percent ticket tax, will expire at the end of 1996.
"Without renewal of the taxes, FAA funding for airport development and saftey and security programs will be threatened," Pena said.
Uncommitted balances in the trust fund are estimated to be completely exhausted by July 1997 if there is no extension.
While asking for an extension of current funding, Pena stressed the Clinton Administration's support for a new long-term financing plan for the FAA.
